programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Things get worse when the shop's landlord appears, and Ton tries to negotiate with him while Allen puts an experimental parachute to the test.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen fight back when a storeowner seems intent on preventing them from scoring new items in Santa Barbara. Plus, the guys discover a vintage wooden boat.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank examine petrol station advertising and memorabilia, and stumble on an exciting piece of motoring history.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the teams pursues a gator that has been preying on cattle, while another bunch of swampers is faced with catches that are too big to get in the boat.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The heaviest lift in two seasons pushes Jamie and the team to their limits, leaving them struggling to complete the rescue and get traffic on the Coquihalla Highway moving again.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to persuade his father to buy a helicopter, before checking a 240-year-old lottery ticket that may have been signed by George Washington.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers assess the value of a spoon made by silversmith and American Revolution patriot Paul Revere, a cuckoo clock from the 1800s and a mysterious vintage archery bow.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions between Karen and Ashley explode on the sales floor, so Les puts them both in the doghouse. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on a buying spree that leaves his staff wondering what is going on. Meanwhile, Karen needs Byron's help to handle a pair of unruly piano players.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: History's greatest geniuses have often said their ideas came from visions or hallucinations. This edition explores the notion that the forces of inspiration the ancients attributed to the gods actually emanated from an otherworldly source.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts question who the Anti-Christ is, considering that every culture and religion on the planet believes that an evil one will usher in the end of days.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Questioning whether technology is going too far, too fast, considering that people rely on machines for virtually every aspect of modern life.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A hustler tries to make Les an offer he cannot refuse, but the Golds fight back and turn the tables on the shady customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley plays a prank on Seth to teach him a lesson about locking his door - but Seth evens the score with a practical joke of his own. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick struggles to get a good deal for a flame-thrower, while Corey and Chumlee head to an auction to bid for a classic gypsy fortune-telling machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine an explosive set of Soviet nuclear missile launch keys and a 1920s Gibson ukulele banjo. Rick Harrison also encounters two of the biggest guns he has ever seen.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Placentia, California, where Rene and Casey buy a locker full of luggage. Meanwhile, Barry is left pondering his future.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones try to raise money to fix their truck. Plus, they get their hands on a foosball table, Tommy gun drums and a hoard of Twinkies.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys battle it out with a fierce former employee, and a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are their last chance to come out on top.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Examining how Chicago's skyscrapers would fare if a tornado such as the one that tore across the city in 1967 were to strike today.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the locations of stargate portals around the world, which some people believe to be doorways to wormholes in time.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An insight into the secrets surrounding the 10 biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the mysterious origins of mummification and any possible influences exerted by extraterrestrials with a superior knowledge of science and engineering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the Golds uncover a series of bogus pawns, their investigation leads to a trusted employee and a confession. Reality series about the running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of vintage cars. Against his children's wishes, Les offers big money for one of the owner's golden oldies.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With Les and Seth away at the Autorama car show - and Ashley in charge of the store - the employees go a little crazy. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Karen tries to make peace between Seth and Ashley, Bobby J takes a two-story tractor for a spin and a watch snob riles Seth.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen face their toughest challenge yet when two old rivals join forces, and the guys find an off-road motorcycle and a pair of net guns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Big Sis revamp the shop to help bring in more customers. Plus, Allen unearths a set of antique basketballs, and goes toe-to-toe with an NBA Hall of Famer.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor Rob Lowe and his family investigate more strange phenomena, this time travelling up to the Redwood Forest to visit the Hoopa Indian Reservation, a hotspot for sightings of Sasquatch, a creature also known as Bigfoot.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: From the paranormal to the extraterrestrial to mysteries, legend and lore, actor Rob Lowe and his family reflect back on their adventures.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave investigates whether the queue's days are numbered, and carries out his own experiment to see how the audience react when someone pushes into a queue. He also wonders if anyone pays any attention to those footprints painted on the ground at cashpoints.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Bob Mortimer, Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Westlife singer Kian Egan are this week's guests, whose stories include licking David Bowie's cake and being ordered to leave town by the police.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Matt Lucas, Jerry Springer and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'noodles' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Host Sue Perkins and the team captains Josh Widdicombe and Richard Osman are joined by guests Danny Baker, Sara Pascoe, Deborah Meaden and Kate Williams for a festive edition of the comedy panel game, with fiendish facts about the Queen's Christmas Speech, Delia Smith's Christmas Cooking and the original Father Christmas, St Nicholas.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Stand-up comedians Ed Gamble, Katherine Ryan and Sindhu Vee are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: There are more problems for Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz as they attempt to retrieve an iconic American sports car that is so rare they have never even heard of it.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in Cambridge's storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Milton Keynes, where portable toilets are up for grabs. Scotty, Heavy D, Linda, Nat and John also fight for the biggest gains in a Dutch auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike and Frank go to Italy in search of the biggest deal of their lives - and get the chance to bring home a classic car.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The guys sort through their haul from Italy, packing a shipping container with retro scooters, antique furniture and religious artefacts.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event which comes from the Cauberg, a hill in the southern town of Valkenburg, Holland.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: At Liege Airport, 61 highly strung show-jumping horses bound for a prestigious Hong Kong event cause total mayhem during loading. The Irish Air Corp perform vital UN training.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi and his team work on a high-performance BMW 330, the Interceptor, while a shortage of staff sees Dave manning the phones.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters find three small cars at an affordable price - a task that involves pestering bankers, harnessing large dogs and almost getting arrested. James May meets American rally driver Ken Block, and Jeremy Clarkson tests out the Mercedes SL Black. Comedian Michael McIntyre is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Lycett shows no mercy to a camel, and Hugh Dennis gets a sleeping bag challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that may be the truth or may be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs divulge what sound like tall tales about themselves, before their rival contestants decide whether they are lying. Greg Davies takes Lee Mack's place as guest captain, and joining him and David Mitchell are choir leader Gareth Malone, Sherlock actress Amanda Abbington, comedian and Buzzcocks panellist Phill Jupitus and Pointless co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Broadcaster and writer Danny Baker, sport presenter Gabby Logan, Citizen Khan creator and star Adil Ray and historian Kate Williams join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Alex, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Johnny Vegas, Ronni Ancona and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'naval navigation' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. In the first episode, the Richardsons decide to throw a huge birthday party for their daughter, Elsie.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges Hugh Dennis to wield a blade, while Mel Giedroyc destroys a mannequin. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan and Phil Wang play a series of video games, including Rayman, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Time Crisis 5, and Let's Get Freddie To Rumble.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Revisiting the killing of brilliant but controversial young playwright Christopher Marlowe, who was stabbed to death in a Deptford lodging house in 1593.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Exploring Victoria Falls, where the Zambezi River creates the largest sheet of falling water in the world.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Devious royal butler Edmund Blackadder steps in to foil a plan by new prime minister Pitt the Younger to bankrupt his master the Prince Regent - but as usual his intentions are not particularly honourable. Rowan Atkinson, Hugh Laurie and Tony Robinson star.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Dr Johnson seeks Prince George's support in publishing his new dictionary, but brainless Baldrick burns the only copy. Edmund sets out to save the English language by rewriting the great man's masterpiece - but he has only one night to complete it. Comedy, guest starring Robbie Coltrane, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth decides to organise a formal party to demonstrate how out of her depth Sarah is. Meanwhile, Carolyn is shocked by Jack's revelation when she challenges him to confront his intimacy issues, and Regina returns home from Europe with news about Sarah. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is closer to George than ever after her triumph at the Swansons' party. However, their happiness is short-lived when they are faced with Regina's bombshell, which sends shockwaves through Inverness. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Peter Baxter is released on bail, even though there is evidence linking him to the disappearance of nurse Manisha Devi - but the subsequent discovery of her burnt body raises the possibility that a dreadful mistake has been made. Samantha presses ahead with the investigation, and identifies another suspect in the form of taxi driver David Russo. Unfortunately, she isn't aware that Ramani is already in the back of his cab, being driven through the streets of Sun Hill by someone who may be a killer.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane is told to work under Ric's supervision when she is blamed for Helen's death, but she is determined to clear her name and attempts to secretly record Nick confessing to his error. A new assistant general manager starts work at the hospital, and soon invites Donna to the May ball, while Matt gets a second job in the admin department to pay off his debts.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy plucks up the courage to audition for a band and a hungover Sean is forced to rethink his life when a friend needs his help. Tim Jenkins, an old friend of Sean's, overdoses.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. A DNA sample seems to rule out cabbie David Russo as the murderer of nurse Manisha Devi - until it transpires that he has cancer and recently underwent a blood transfusion that could have affected the test result. Peter Baxter is stabbed by a traumatised Ruth Cohen, while June has a run-in with a 13-year-old arson suspect and later calls the station to report a rape - naming herself as victim.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur finally confesses everything to Pauline.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline kicks Arthur out after he discloses his affair with Mrs Hewett, with Michelle, Mark and Kathy drawn into the crossfire.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George, Kevin and Bayleaf train with the new brigade helicopter, while back on the ground, their Blue Watch partners-in-peril tackle a terrifying bedsit blaze.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul tries to make his mark on Glenbogle but quickly runs into trouble, in the form of new arrival Isobel, while an unexpected visit from Lexie causes heartbreak for Duncan. Molly is horrified to learn there is a thief on the estate, while Highland Radio Authority officer Parker is on the trail of pirate station Rob Roy Radio. Drama, starring Susan Hampshire, Dawn Steele and Hamish Clark.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Skelthwaite Scorpions play a crunch match against rival team the Bridlington Trawlers, but fare badly, prompting David to demand a return engagement. Meanwhile, Anna's distress at her split with Simon is compounded by the financial hardship of running a business single-handed _ but just as disaster looms, a shady businessman makes her an offer for the factory. Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean decides to go online, but Lionel is not so sure it is a good idea, and Judith's ex-boyfriend Alistair comes up against a big problem. Comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy tries to implement a new fitness regime, but Clegg is reluctant to take part and insists some of the world's nicest people are out of shape. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently arrive in a small town to investigate the apparent suicide of a mill manager who has been found hanged. However, the detectives begin to suspect foul play as they discover money has gone missing and the victim's widow reveals he was having an affair. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News with Adam Boulton

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Contestants from across the UK take on Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster travels along the Staffordshire and Worcestershire canal, widely regarded as one of the oldest and prettiest waterways in Britain. On his journey he marvels at ingenious 18th-century engineering, tackles the difficult skill of glassblowing and discovers a secret underground cold war bunker.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Coleen Nolan, Nadia Sawalha, Denise Welch, and Jane Moore are on the Loose Women panel in this episode, interviewing celebrity guests and discussing the day's most topical issues, from current affairs to celebrity gossip and the latest showbiz news. Emmerdale star Chris Bisson is in the studio to talk about the huge factory fire plotline that has everyone talking, and what it means for the future of the show.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James takes a trip to the Cairngorms National Park, joined by Nick Nairn. They visit some friendly reindeer and brave the rapids on the River Spey, where they go whitewater rafting.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five work colleagues from Kent answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Belle implores Jamie to forget about their affair and fix things with Andrea, while DI Malone explains a new dangerous job to Cain, Will and Billy - who cannot help but feel apprehensive. Leanna is pleased to cause a rift between Liam and Leyla, and Paddy struggles to hide his anxiety.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff checks the secret security camera feed on his phone and is intrigued to see Yasmeen stuffing clothes into a holdall and locking it in a cupboard by the stairs. When Summer explains to Billy that Kelly's mum has abandoned her, he agrees to let her stay at their flat, while Dev agrees to phone the school and try to withdraw his complaint.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the opening episode, the siblings arrive in India and have an extremely fiery introduction to the local cuisine. They also give the kids at their grandad's old school a crash course in how to talk like true Mancs, and make a major discovery about the relatives their grandad left behind.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady helps to train a Pomeranian puppy called Stormy who arrived in Battersea at only nine weeks old. Elsewhere, Paul meets a French bulldog in desperate need of an operation to open his airways, and there is also an arrival of 20 dogs who turn up unexpectedly in need of temporary accommodation.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts at once.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts at once.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology used to dive for natural sponges, and how taxi drivers know their way to so many destinations.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China works on restoring Mike Brewer's Mercedes 190-E, which features a Cosworth engine, incorporating a new suspension system and track rod end.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues work on the Mercedes. Jobs remaining before the car can be resold by Mike Brewer include fitting a set of tyres and a new exhaust.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton takes Hus on an Italian road-trip. From Venice to Lake Garda, the pair meet up with dealers whose objects tell the story of Italy's role in the Second World War.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Lee drops into OCC, seeking advice from Paul Sr about his new business, and PJD debuts its top-secret bike.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: The world's most impressive trains, including the tilting N700 Bullet from Japan and France's high speed TGV service.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins a father-and-son team to harvest sponges at sea, before struggling to remove a metal fence post from an abandoned mine.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Carbon Fibre/Antique Frame Restoration/Railcar Movers/Hood Ornaments
programme.desc: The development processed behind the creation of carbon fibre, railcar movers and hood ornaments. Plus, the techniques used in antique frame restoration.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, this time examining how sawhorses and toolboxes, sorbet pops and school buses are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the process behind the making of cheddar, widely considered the world's most popular cheese. Plus, the mechanisms inside Resusci Anne - the learning aid used to teach CPR.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Empty crab pots create tension among the fleet, as unrewarding fishing in the Bering Sea whittles away the crews' profit and affects morale.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Following fishing crews through the highs and lows of the competitive and risky abalone season in Port Lincoln, South Australia.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Mazda coupe that appears to have nothing wrong with it, so he decides to give expert mechanic Edd China the task of making a good car even better.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to the US to hunt for a DeLorean DMC-12, a car that ceased production in 1982. Once he has acquired one, Edd China is given the task of restoring the stainless steel-clad vehicle, which was manufactured in Belfast.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini visits Monterey for auction week, where two of his cars have already sold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wayne Carini travels to Amelia Island in Florida, where rare vehicles are being purchased by European collectors at an auction of vintage motorcars.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the gravity-defying 'magic' behind Pisa's leaning tower. Plus, the making of chocolate digestive biscuits.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How ancient Greeks invented parchment with techniques still used today. Plus, the making of shuttlecocks.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Winter storms are set to rage, which could halt all diving for weeks, and the crews have to find new ways to keep the abalone coming in and secure their income.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jake Harris is given an important lesson on driving the Cornelia Marie, and disaster strikes on board the Wizard when one of the crewmen becomes caught in the line.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton uncovers plans for the D-Day invasion. Plus, he experiences a bumpy landing for a Dakota aeroplane, and in France his passion hits new heights with a parachute jump.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Holland where, thanks to its thriving antiques markets, he can find the kind of unique pieces he's renowned for - including his dream car, a vintage Bugatti.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Master blacksmith Neville Morris works on a piece of railing that was once a Victorian club fender. Meanwhile, Martin restores a Second World War RAF hero's bomber jacket.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China works on restoring Mike Brewer's Mercedes 190-E, which features a Cosworth engine, incorporating a new suspension system and track rod end.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues work on the Mercedes. Jobs remaining before the car can be resold by Mike Brewer include fitting a set of tyres and a new exhaust.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Cheshire barn packed with items, from traditional antique furniture to taxidermy. In Sheffield, he uncovers a collection of early 20th-century glass eyes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When architectural salvage hunter Drew Pritchard and his sidekick Tee gain access to a recently closed department store, they face a potentially almighty shopping spree.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland leap at the chance to buy a rare pickup version of a mini, but the decision about what to do with the tatty canvas load cover causes some creative differences.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz continue to hunt down objects with historical, collectable and pop culture value that have been long forgotten by their owners. In the heart of Texas, a family's vintage service station is just like a petroliana museum where the awesome inventory is all off-limits.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in transporting cash securely, how big-game fish are caught, and the workings of a set of bagpipes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in turning water into whisky, and how preparations are made to cope with another natural disaster on the scale of Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bloodiest gun battle in the FBI's history, which occurred on April 11, 1986, when agents attempted to apprehend two suspects responsible for a prolonged crime spree.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of a family of five in Beason, Illinois, in September 2009. Armed robber Chris Harris was later convicted of killing Rick and Ruth Gee and three of their children.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents and members of the public become involved in the search for an eight-year-old girl who has been abducted.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators find themselves tackling one of their biggest ever hoarding cases when they uncover over 120 cats living inside a house in terrible conditions.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two girls wait anxiously as Dr Chris Brown works to save their rabbit.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An Australian kelpie is brought to the surgery after a knock to its head causes severe difficulties with balancing, and a brain scan reveals the problems are inoperable.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah visits the salon with her family, but her sister's opinion is the most important, while Bethany searches for a dress that goes against her mother's wishes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Angie has always dreamed of a laidback country wedding - but her sister Carolina wants her bridesmaid dress to be sparkly, and is determined to get her way.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour turns into a monster when it is pointed out she is the only unmarried maid - and when the tension rises, it is left to the bride-to-be to save the day.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a West Highland terrier overcome his phobia of skateboards and visits the Australian Reptile Park to take swabs from an alligator and a python.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown hopes to find a new home for an orphaned Shih Tzu with a chronic ear problem.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The full horror of illegal dog fighting is revealed when an investigator finds a pit bull that's been shot and beaten to death. And a pack of stray cats outwits the team.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team discovers a shocking case of animal cruelty when a neglected horse suffers a fatal injury.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Why crimes in which there is no personal connection between the killer and victim may remain unsolved for years.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: Hard Life in the Big Easy
programme.desc: The case of 39-year-old Dana Pastor, who disappeared in 2002 after telling friends she had decided to leave her adopted home town of New Orleans. When Hurricane Katrina struck in 2005, her mummified corpse was discovered in a wooden trunk.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of interior designer William 'Billy' McGrath, a self-made millionaire, who went missing in August 2009. His body was located two years later, buried under a house, some months after handyman Brad Tocker had been arrested on suspicion of fraud and identification theft.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the vital role of DNA analysis in solving crimes, and how the discovery of a single hair or drop of blood can help to put a criminal behind bars.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A bride hopes for a stress-free big day, but trouble soon rears its head.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A bride makes elaborate plans for her wedding - but the possibility of rain threatens to ruin everything.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A bride's family struggles to cope with not being the centre of attention on her big day.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits spend a day at a market in Villeneuve-les-Avignon in the south of France. Back in the UK, they have to upcycle their purchases before selling everything on London's Portobello Road. Rob shows how to convincingly restore a battered frame, Natalie is convinced she'll make hundreds out of an apple cart, and Keira gives a little love to add value to a wooden trunk.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, London Road Pawnbrokers boss Dan hunts for a local artist regarding potentially valuable paintings, and an unusual silver sombrero could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Paula's husband died due to weight-related complications. She is now worried her obesity will kill her and leave her children without parents, so is advised of the steps to take.

programme.title: My Feet Are Killing Me
programme.desc: A man with an extremely rare disease has the largest feet Dr Schaeffer has ever seen. Plus, an athlete with two different-sized feet presents a difficult surgery.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: The Boy Whose Eye Falls Out
programme.desc: Sulaiman suffers from Cruzon syndrome, which causes his eye to fall from his skull, and Tony became a hermit when huge lumps grew around his face.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a racially motivated serial killer - a sniper who murdered at least 20 African-American men but left few clues and no witnesses. A countrywide appeal eventually yielded the number of a Kentucky number plate, and led police to white supremacist Joseph Paul Franklin - who promptly escaped custody. He was finally arrested two months later, having made his way to Tampa, Florida.
